screenshot.caption: DXA file open in VLC media player

description: Adventure Soft Publishing is a British video game studio that was founded in 1992 and has released ten video games. The publisher is best known for its Simon the Sorcerer series of games.

In 1997, Adventure Soft Publishing released The Feeble Files for Amiga, Macintosh, and Windows. The game follows the adventures of an alien named Feeble, as he attempts to overthrow the dystopian Omni-Brain which runs his world.
NOTE: Feeble was voiced by Robert Llewylln, one of the stars of British science-fiction sitcom Red Dwarf.
